{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3536187,"name":"rahilm","username":"rahilm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/d9b06d/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T05:08:04.379Z","cooked":"

When deploying robot code (python), the rio canbus seems to not be available. Our Canivore loop is fine during this time. The symptom is lots of stale CAN frame errors in Driverstation (corresponding to all the IDs on that loop). Looking at Tuner, we see the same with none of the Rio loop devices visible.

After restarting robot code, normal behavior resumes

We’ve checked and all our packages are up to date. Any thoughts or do we just continue using the workaround?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T05:08:04.379Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492680,"topic_slug":"rio-canbus-not-available-after-deploy","display_username":"rahilm","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12790,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rio-canbus-not-available-after-deploy/492680/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3536188,"name":"Juliette Johnson","username":"Juliette_5533","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e9c0ed/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T05:15:17.365Z","cooked":"

So occasionally you’ll upload and not have all your motors? We are experiencing this same issue with a can bus as well

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T05:15:17.365Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":138,"readers_count":137,"score":32.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492680,"topic_slug":"rio-canbus-not-available-after-deploy","display_username":"Juliette Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64204,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rio-canbus-not-available-after-deploy/492680/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3536196,"name":"kylelanman","username":"kylelanman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kylelanman/{size}/3427_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T05:37:00.997Z","cooked":"

In python It doesn’t fully terminate the previous version of code before starting up the new and it struggles to attach to the CAN bus. We fought it last year on python. We switched to Java this year. It is annoying in the shop but it always works on boot so not a problem at competition.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T05:37:00.997Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492680,"topic_slug":"rio-canbus-not-available-after-deploy","display_username":"kylelanman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64204,"username":"Juliette_5533","name":"Juliette Johnson","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e9c0ed/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9953,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rio-canbus-not-available-after-deploy/492680/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3536226,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T08:05:19.754Z","cooked":"

We fixed it last year in the same way that Java fixed it, but I hadn’t heard that it was still broken. Will have to look into it.

Came across the post with the fix from last year as well, so I thought we were doing something wrong.

Thanks for looking into it and please let me know if there’s any other info we can provide

I don’t have the hardware to reproduce this, but it seems that GradleRIO kills the robot program before it does a deploy. This PR does that too, please try it out: Kill the robot before copying files by virtuald · Pull Request #138 · robotpy/robotpy-installer · GitHub

You can install it via:

pip install git+https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-installer.git@really-kill-robot

We just gave it a shot, but still seeing the same behavior. Confirmed with pip list that we’re running the correct version

Hm. I made a different branch with verbose logging.

pip install git+https://github.com/robotpy/robotpy-installer.git@log-robot-killing

Please install that, and when it fails, copy the text here. It should have lots of + in the output.
